In method 'DZService_SelectType.BindChildren(ServiceType, RepeaterItem)', object 'hlServiceType' is not disposed along all exception paths. Call System.IDisposable.Dispose on object 'hlServiceType' before all references to it are out of scope.

Rule.Name: Dispose objects before losing scope
Rule.Description: If a disposable object is not explicitly disposed before all references to it are out of scope, the object will be disposed at some indeterminate time when the garbage collector runs the finalizer of the object. Because an exceptional event might occur that will prevent the finalizer of the object from running, the object should be explicitly disposed instead.

Rule.Name: Do not raise exceptions in unexpected locations
Rule.Description: Do not explicitly raise exceptions from unexpected locations. There are some methods, such as Equals and GetHashCode, which users do not expect to raise exceptions. Therefore calls to these methods are not commonly wrapped in try catch blocks.
